intro: Hieracium pseudosparsum subsp. elatianum, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. The plant features basal rosettes of leaves and produces yellow composite flowers in late summer. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped with a rough, hairy texture. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and is often found in disturbed habitats.
